sn55.11:0.3: A Saṅgha of a Thousand Nuns
sn55.11:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the Royal Monastery.
sn55.11:1.2: Then a Saṅgha of a thousand nuns went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side. The Buddha said to them:
sn55.11:2.1: “Nuns, a noble disciple who has four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.
sn55.11:2.3: It’s when a noble disciple has experiential confidence in the Buddha …
sn55.11:2.7: And they have the ethical conduct loved by the noble ones … leading to immersion.
sn55.11:2.8: A noble disciple who has these four things is a stream-enterer, not liable to be reborn in the underworld, bound for awakening.”
